Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: more cultural knowledge and grammar improvement
Through this course I learned far more grammar than I even knew existed. We also learned a lot about the history and culture of the Spanish-speaking world, which I really enjoyed.

I learned so much Spanish and gained a lot of comfort in my usage of the language. This was a great opportunity for me to consolidate things I learned in L3 and keep up my language usage, as well as learning new vocabulary and language structures.
improvement of reading, writing, and speaking Spanish skills
I became comfortable with using Spanish everyday again after not speaking it (regularly) for two years.
My grammar improved drastically in this course. While my speaking and writing have improved some, my grammar is light years ahead of where it was.
a lot of work but very engaging

There's not much I would change about the course, but I do think the assignments were a little too concentrated in the last part of the semester for no reason. I think things like presentations could have been done earlier, and eased some of the stress at the end.
The course could be a little dry at times/repetitive. That said, it was strong in terms of learning the language well.

strengths: use of many different materials to engage students in all types of Spanish usage; kind and caring professor
weaknesses: daily busy work online with VHL (didn't provide a lot of substance for Spanish practice); workload progressed and escalated very quickly from L3 Spanish
Strengths of the course include learning about Latin American history while learning Spanish. This part of the course was really interesting - it is not just grammar!

I think the content of the course is good and sets people up for success in spanish. However, the second half of the term, after getting back from spring break, had significantly more work than the first half, and I think this could be better balanced (the work wasn't hard, there was just a lot more of it).
yes if you are dedicated to learning Spanish as it is very helpful but a lot of work!

This is a solid course designed to help you consolidate the Spanish you have learned and learn some more vocab/grammatical structures. I found the course pretty manageable except towards the end, when the workload definitely ramped up a lot.
Yesit's adequate preparation for higher level courses. However, it's a lot of work.

If you need free time during your semester, then do not take this course. Especially towards the second half of the semester, the work load starts becoming ridiculous. It detracted me from my other classes. However, if you love Spanish and have the time, this class is definitely for you
Professor Len is a very good teacher and will help improve your spanish. I am so thankful for her guidance. I was challenged, but wasnt over worked. I learned a ton.
For those who really want a strong spanish foundation, I would for sure recommend the course.
